intro: Brachystelma lankanum, commonly known as the Lankanum stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are small, thick, and often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. It produces clusters of star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in late summer.
